nextgen.core.model
Class AlignmentModel

java.lang.Object
  nextgen.core.annotation.AbstractAnnotationCollection<Alignment>
      nextgen.core.model.AlignmentModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
AnnotationCollection<Alignment>
Direct Known Subclasses:
ScanStatisticDataAlignmentModel
public class AlignmentModel
extends AbstractAnnotationCollection<Alignment>

Serves the purpose of the Generic DataAlignment model and the ContinuousDataAlignmentModel Will populate alignments If a paired end file has unmapped mates, it will be represented by a single end read If both mates are mapped it will be represented as paired end reads Therefore a single model might have both, use flag X to exclude or include only one type This will be a bridge to the analysis modules

Author:
skadri

getBasesCovered

public int getBasesCovered(Annotation region,
                           boolean fullyContained)
Description copied from interface: AnnotationCollection
This method will return the total number of bases that are covered by alignments in the collection If discontinuous region, it will only count blocks The maximum possible value is defined by region.getTranscriptSize();

Parameters:
region - The region to determine overlap
fullyContained - Whether to count only fully contained reads
Returns:

getPermutedAnnotations

public net.sf.samtools.util.CloseableIterator<Alignment> getPermutedAnnotations(Annotation region)
Description copied from interface: AnnotationCollection
Shuffle the locations of annotations within the given region and return an iterator over the permuted annotations. Permuted annotations will not be necessarily sorted. NOTE: This will alter the annotations in the reader, so re-reading or reloading might be necessary.

Parameters:
region - reads reads fully contained in this region will be shuffled

getBasesCovered

public int getBasesCovered(Annotation region)
Description copied from interface: AnnotationCollection
This method will return the total number of bases that are covered by alignments in the collection If discontinuous region, it will only count blocks. The maximum possible value is defined by region.getTranscriptSize(); Annotations counted here do not need to be fully contained in the region.

Specified by:
getBasesCovered in interface AnnotationCollection<Alignment>
Overrides:
getBasesCovered in class AbstractAnnotationCollection<Alignment>
Parameters:
region - The region to determine overlap
Returns:
